adventure_overview: Discovering what floats and how to make a model boat are the key activities in this Adventure. Prior to any activity, use Scouting America SAFE Checklist to ensure the safety of all those involved. All participants in official Scouting America activities should become familiar with the Guide to Safe Scouting and applicable program literature or manuals.

requirements.text: Identify five different types of boats.

activities.name: Color the Boats
activities.description: Color the boats in the Tiger handbook.

activities.name: Model Boats
activities.description: Identify different types of boats using models.

activities.name: Visit a Marina
activities.description: See real boats by visiting a marina.

requirements.text: Identify five things that float and five things that do not float.

activities.name: Floating or Sinking?
activities.description: In a tub discover things that float and things that do not.

requirements.text: Build or create a model boat and float it on the water. This can be made from recycled materials or other items.

activities.name: Crafty Boat
activities.description: Make a model boat from recycled and craft supplies.

activities.name: Paper Boat
activities.description: Fold paper to make a boat using the Tiger handbook.

requirements.text: Show that you can put on and fasten a life jacket correctly and learn when it is safe to enter a boat.

activities.name: Life Jacket Relay
activities.description: Once Cub Scouts learn how to proper fit a life jacket conduct a relay race.

activities.name: Proper Fit – Proper Safety
activities.description: Cub Scouts try on a properly fitted life jacket.
